content: this legal case involves two parties sklep and vrhovno sodišče rs ii dor 1072020 the supreme court made a decision on june 5 2020 the case went through several steps including a cost procedure to determine the amount of money to be paid the court then reviewed the data and made a decision in the first instance judgment finally the supreme court reviewed the case and awarded compensation the case involved various assets such as a real estate apartment a kia passenger car cash assets and insurance policies the total value of these assets is approximately 3694334 eur the judgment divided the assets between the plaintiff and the defendant with the plaintiff receiving 40 and the defendant receiving 60 the supreme court dismissed the application for revision the case was based on the marriage family relations act and the civil procedure act the court ruled on the division of coowned property between two deceased individuals the court determined the value of the assets and ordered the defendant to issue a permit for the applicant to register ownership rights for a portion of real estate the court also dismissed an alternative claim made by one party against the other the court of second instance reviewed the appeal and amended the judgment made by the court of first instance the court of appeal is seeking permission to appeal a case involving the rights and contributions of a disabled partner in a cohabitation situation the appeal raises questions about whether the disabled partners work and care should be considered as a form of work that gives rise to coowned property the appeal also addresses the issue of whether the partner can claim monetary value for their services and if this claim should entitle them to a share of the coowned property the high court departed from previous caselaw regarding the consideration of investment money used to purchase property as coowned property the court decision ii ips 2362008 determined whether a property acquired during a partnership was joint or separate property based on the partners contributions the court decision ii ips 1762001 and the supreme courts position on the matter were also discussed the court considered the higher income of one partner and the care provided by the deceased partners mother when determining the division of coowned property the court of appeal determined that the specific nature of work done to increase and preserve the value of assets must be established the supreme court has not yet taken a position on whether cohabiting partners are entitled to mutual assistance and whether a partner who contributes significantly to the personal work and preservation of coowned property can make a claim the supreme court has determined that the conditions for review have been fulfilled and dismissed the application for review the decision was unanimous
